website_summaries.verdict: A multi-device compatible cord that works perfectly with desktops, laptops, smartphones, tablets, and individual wall chargers.
pros: The fast USB 3.0 cord supports outdated USB versions on older devices
Will work with popular Android devices like the Samsung Galaxy S8
cons: Uses cheaper materials that may not survive rough use over time

customer_reviews.title: Cable failed after a few months
customer_reviews.text: The cable is in perfect condition and was working just fine until recently. Now, when I connect the cable between my external drive and my windows pc, i get and error in the windows tray, 'usb device not recognised'. The cable appears in great condition, but is no longer working. I don't know why, maybe it didn't tolerate the constant bending. Also, not the cables fault, but transfer speed via my usb3.0 slot maxed out around 40MB/s. That is my fault for not buying a gen-2 cable, but this isn't even usb3.0 speed. My rating is based on the cable totally failing, not on the speed. Other other cable is working just fine, so maybe I got unlucky?
customer_reviews.author: Jed

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Tight Fit
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought I had accidentally ordered the wrong type of cable, because this didn't seem to fit my Samsung Galaxy S8. But after some strong effort, I determined that it IS the right cable. just an extremely tight fit. I'm frustrated that this has so many positive reviews... that's why I bought it... but the effort to plug it into the phone and pull it out is a strain that takes extra time and seems likely to cause problems. I've never had a cable do this before and I've owned several.
customer_reviews.author: Space Salamander

customer_reviews.title: Great, compact, and recommended for a Switch!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted! It charges my Switch effectively, it's a great size, and it comes with a wrap strap attached to it to keep it together. One thing that's surprisingly overlooked and not detailed in descriptions is the cord. It's very thin, which means you can wind this tight and it'll bend easily. I've very pleased with that! So many cords are too thick and don't wrap well. This does. This is great. I've only had it for a few days so I can't comment on its durability, but it looks and functions very well.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Really like how slim these cables are.
customer_reviews.text: We actually really like the slim nature of this cable, especially for travel. So many cables these days can be pretty thick. On the surface, it may seem that they would be more durable, but it adds significantly to the bulk that it takes in our travel kits. These cables are plenty durable (never had one fail, yet), but are noticeably slimmer. We have small ready-to-go travel kit that has chargers and cables. These are the only ones we take in that bag. And we use others around the house. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: A's Fan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: This cable surely was a rare item to find at any of my local stores ( Best buy, Staples, MicroCenter, Walmart etc). Perfect to keep it in my car to charge my Google Pixel 2 as it is my first USB-C device and did not wanted to buy a whole USB-C car charger as I already own a pretty solid one with two usb ports. I am happy with my purchase as this cable is just exactly what I needed to charge my new phone on the go while driving. If you own a Google Pixel 2 or any USB-C type device and need to charge it while on the road, look no further than this cable. 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Jean C. Montes

customer_reviews.title: These seem to be great cables!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these so I can continue to plug my phone into my car stereo (for Android Auto), Gorilla Gadgets charge pack, 2.1 amp home chargers (so I don't kill the battery with constant use of Turbo Charger for my Moto Z Force), etc. They have a great fit and seem to be of very good quality after using them for over a month now. The thin cord does not slow down the charging speed, and makes it very easy to use your phone while it's plugged in to something, where other thicker cords have permanent bends in them from when they were packaged. Very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: Does not transfer data with Google Pixel 3a
customer_reviews.text: This cable is not a USB 3.1 cable. The USB A male end only has 4 pins, not the 8 that a USB 3.1 cable should have. The cable works for charging and that's it. This is NOT a data cable and if you manage to transfer data over it it will be at USB 2.0 speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: good simple cable for charging
customer_reviews.text: I have used this cable for a couple months now to charge my nexus 5X i my car and it has been very good. i have had no issues with it at all. i haven't done any sort of scientific research but it does indeed charge my phone. Quality compared to other usb cables seems above average but not premium. honestly it will be a while before i can give it a full review. i will report issues if the arise.
customer_reviews.author: Pikaman

customer_reviews.title: A certain site famous for their cheap cables does have ...
customer_reviews.text: A certain site famous for their cheap cables does have a thicker A-to-C cable for a little cheaper, but (obviously) it isn't eligible for free 2-day shipping. So long as you know it's a little pricier than it needs to be and it's a little thin, if you decide to buy this it will perform the function that you expect a cable to perform. I went in well aware that I chose this one for fast free Prime shipping, and it was exactly what I expected--hence five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Darius

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Inadequate durability, would not purchase again. Worked fine initially, and for a period of about 3 years, under very light use (limited bending). Then cable failed without warning by shorting out near the cable-to-connector transition (cable had no visible damage prior to failure). Cable Matter's cable is noticeably thinner than other manufacturers, suggesting durability may be substandard. While Cable Matters did not specify its cable would meet a minimum number of bending cycles like some other manufacturers, the cable should've lasted longer in my opinion. Replaced with an AmazonBasics cable - seems thicker and more robust, but only time will tell. I recommend purchasing the AmazonBasics cable over this one.
customer_reviews.author: MTE

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cable to use on the external HDD that I connect to my MacBook Pro. Finally getting rid of the dongles! Or so I thought. I plugged this in and received no notification that it has connected to my computer. I checked the external itself to see if the drives are spinning and nothing happens. I even checked the old cable to make sure my HDD didn't die, and that old cable started instantly. Very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work but wrong size (updated)
customer_reviews.text: I was told this would be 1 ft long. Instead all cables are roughly 3 inches long, hardly enough space to set it down in the car. I bought this for use with android auto, so shorter was ok, but not less than 1 ft! UPDATE: Ive bumped up my review rating because support did contact me and seemed nice enough, and as it turns out the size was correct- it's just that one foot is apparently incredibly small- so I cancelled the replacement, but the followup is appreciated, and to their credit, the cord very much still does work for android auto, which is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Tahseen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. Failed.
customer_reviews.text: First cable to fail on me. Junk! Have a Google Pixel 2 and it started causing my phone to turn off once plugged in. Then it quit doing that and saying my phone was charging when it actually wasn't. Phone battery drained to zero while using for GPS. Used another brand of cable and it worked totally fine.
customer_reviews.author: KevShots

customer_reviews.title: Poor Reliability and Connectivity,  Stopped Charging Fast
customer_reviews.text: I thought these cables were going to be a good value and liked them at first, but very shortly after I started using them I found that they will get an error when trying to connect my phone to the PC and will often charge only very very slowly. Using other cables fixes the problem, so I suspect it is a low quality connection or low durability from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Compatriot VCast

customer_reviews.title: Poor Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these a year ago and every time I have to charge my phone with these cables I actually have to flip them over and try again damn near constantly. And that's even if it has to do with the connector. I thought the whole point of USB C was for it to not matter what side went in? Well it's either that or the cable being somehow too bent to work right on a regular table.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Fassbender

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but don’t last
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. They look nice but yikes. They soon need “rebooting” plug em out then plug em in otherwise they don’t work. I’d give them 3 stars but i feel like they are a waste of environmental resources they get 1 star. I have to replace them prematurely
customer_reviews.author: Native Commissioner

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have a couple of the correct USB connectors for our new Note 10+ phones to plug into USB ports in our cars to charge our phones when needed while driving. Like that they are short enough to not be in the way of driver or passenger.
customer_reviews.author: lcfan

customer_reviews.title: Good USB C cables
customer_reviews.text: Wat can I say? They are cables that connect USB C devices to your computer/charger/etc. However, I do like the fact that they come with cable wraps with hook-and-loop fasteners (invented by Auguste Van Hookenlooper in 1963).
customer_reviews.author: Tim Crow

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and low profile.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my car. All other cables have been THICK and don't fit inside my cubby so it made my car untidy. This would not do. When i found this cable I immediately purchased it and when it arrived it was exactly as I expected. It's small enough to coil up and be plugged in to my phone for android auto at the same time with the cubby closed.
customer_reviews.author: CLC

customer_reviews.title: Adds versatility to my new accessory charger.
customer_reviews.text: A recently acquired auxiliary battery charger came with a 110 plug but sometimes you aren’t near an outlet. This allows the charger to be charged with my car’s USB. The port is an in/out port and I can also use the USB as a third charging port.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jaynes

customer_reviews.title: Well made cable that makes a good connection.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good, solid cable. My phone charging jack is getting a bit worn and loose, and so far this is the best cable I've found for staying plugged in and delivering maximum current without excessive heating. Update -- I like this cable so well, I've started buying Cable Matters cables for all my cable needs (which seem to be prodigious lately.)
customer_reviews.author: Gary in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Usable cables
customer_reviews.text: The cables are generally fine. The bases of the plugs are reinforced and don't seem like they'd fray easily. The length is misleading. 6-inches describes the full length of the product including the plugs. The "cable" part is only 3-4 inches.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Essential as USB being replaced by USB-C
customer_reviews.text: I suppose these work, but both Mac and PCs Google Nexus 5 phone not recognizing phone. I managed to go into Developer mode, and it worked. Once. Now I just upload pix and vid to Google drive, then access from my Mac. That is only reason I got this cable. Not their fault my Droid phone so funky. Now that Apple Macbook might be replacing USB for USB-C, I suppose these cables will become more popular. Maybe I'll use this someday other than merely charging my phone using a Hub connected to my iMac.
customer_reviews.author: TrixieTop Contributor: Watercolor Painting

customer_reviews.title: Well made cable.
customer_reviews.text: Long enough to be useful. Good build quality - sturdy connectors and reinforced cable connections to the connectors. Very flexible cable.
customer_reviews.author: BmanTN

customer_reviews.title: Got perfect compliant cable on the second try--fantastic service
customer_reviews.text: My initial order of this cable was defective (it failed the CheckR test). Upon contacting Cable Matters, their representatives rushed out a replacement cable, which was in my hands mere days after. The replacement cable did indeed pass the CheckR test. I hesitated a bit whether to give this product a lower score because of the initial defective nature but decided that their amazing responsiveness combined with a fully working replacement cable warrants the full 5 stars. My only caveat would be to check the cable that you receive and reach out for a replacement if it's defective like my first one.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Better Price
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy with the product that came. It seems very well made, is exactly the length I need, and I swear my phone charges quicker than it did with the cord I bought at like Kmart or CVS or something. Either way, this product was definitely worth the price, especially since a Belkin at Best Buy runs $20 for the same exact thing. My only complaint is that I feel like it might rip because of how thin the cord is, but it seems to be holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound1211

customer_reviews.title: Works with Android Auto / Hyundai SF sport 2018 / Google Pixel 2 XL
customer_reviews.text: Yes yes yes! Paydirt, the mother lode! This is the 5th cable I've tried to get Android Auto to work with 2018 Hyundai Santa Fe Sport and Google Pixel 2 XL. All others failed. So far this one is working flawlessly. I'll update this review if I have any problems or issues but so far so good. Battery charge/drain seems to be a net zero when using Android auto with downloaded spotify songs and google maps navigation (ie, the charge appears to be just enough to keep up with the usage).
customer_reviews.author: OptimusLibri

customer_reviews.title: Works as described and as intended
customer_reviews.text: I got this three-pack for half of the price of the equivalent item on the Google Store! And the Google Store price was for one cable only! The cables work as described. It connects my Google Pixel 3 phone perfectly to my laptop and I can do all the data transfers that I need. Overall I'm satisfied and I give this product a 5-star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Soumyottam Chatterjee

customer_reviews.title: Degrade rapidly
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, this cable worked great, but after using about a month, it is no longer able to charge the device. The device says it is charging, but overnight, the charge actually goes down. I am actually avoiding Cable Matters becuase of my experience with this cable degrading over time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly, feels good, durable
customer_reviews.text: use these on a daily basis in my car for charging my phone and work flawlessly and take a fair share of beating. Pixel 3 stock cable didn't hold up nearly as well as these and they look clean. Its a pleasure to use :)
customer_reviews.author: JMan

customer_reviews.title: Google Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was brought here as these were one of the recommended cables by Google for Android Auto. The cable seems stable and the craftmanship seems good. The only issue I seemed to have with it was my Samsung Note 10+ could recognize that it wasn't an OEM cable and wasn't able to charge as fast.
customer_reviews.author: GA5

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Samsung phones.
customer_reviews.text: Just got a Galaxy Note 8. I tried these cables with 3 existing QC 2.0 chargers. A Samsung wall charger, an Aukey backup battery, and an Aukey car charger. All of them were able to quick charge the Note 8 with these cables.
customer_reviews.author: bevorules77

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Type A to USB Type C cable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cable for my nexus 5x. The standard cable that comes with the phone is only usb type c on both ends. This cable allows u to either connect to your USB Type A chargers or your standard laptop USB Ports. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TMalone

customer_reviews.title: Finally fast charge feature is working again on Galaxy S8
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other recently purchased USB-C, Cable Matters gets it right! Kept having issues with connectivity using other brands including Samsung. Finally replaced enough cables to weed out all the useless ones. Connector seems to have a tighter fit than other brands. Not sure if that is the magic, but it is noticeable. Purchased both 3' and 6' versions. Both are working. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: EJ_UpNorth

customer_reviews.title: Nice snug fit
customer_reviews.text: My Samsung Galaxy S9 is a couple of years old now and most cables, like AmazonBasics and Anker, don't seem to fit snugly in the charging socket anymore and don't work for charging my phone. These cables do work, so if you have an older phone that is finicky about cables, give these a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cluggish

customer_reviews.title: Not that durable.
customer_reviews.text: Did not last two years. The head - c has insulation brake and cable inside are exposed. Cable is use at air conditioned office away from direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: DenZ

customer_reviews.title: Wrong measurement way too short.
customer_reviews.text: Very upset about this. I really like the cable but when they say 6 inches they are including both connectors in that measurement....not the cable length. Do the actual cable ends up being around 2 inches or so which is too small for me. I was wanting to use it for android auto but its too short and now I have to buy another one because of how they measure it. Otherwise the cable itself is a nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Josh H

customer_reviews.title: 6ft cable is thinner than the 3ft cable. Even better.
customer_reviews.text: I own a ton of A to C cables from this company. This time I ordered a 6.6 ft cable to reach the outlet. It is just as good as their other cables, and the orange band let's you know that it is the longer length. White band is on the 3 ft cable. This length is offered in a narrower sheath, which makes it even more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Cars and Tech by JDM City

customer_reviews.title: One Star. (Up-rated)
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this cable on Dec 5th. It doesn't pass the CheckR app on Nexus 6P. Avoid! Update. After posting the above review, I was contacted by the seller and offered another cable. Apparently, the new generation has been upgraded. The replacement arrived in just a few days. The new cable does pass the CheckR test using Nexus 6P.
customer_reviews.author: G.K.

customer_reviews.title: Buy With Confidence
customer_reviews.text: Great product and trustworthy seller. Ordered one of these for my Nexus 5X after Mr. Leung posted that they were compliant with the relevant standards. However, after receiving the cable I tested it with the CheckR app, which flunked it. I e-mailed CableMatters with the issue and they immediately responded, apologized for the old stock on Amazon, and sent me a new cable w/ tracking number the same day. The new cable came today, passed CheckR, and works perfectly for both charging and data transfer. The cable appears to be high quality as well. Will definitely keep these guys in mind for future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: APK

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tavel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use while traveling. Our standard USB-C cables are fairly thick and stiff. These are a bit thinner and more flexible, which is good for travel when packing and unpacking. It's also good when carrying with you on the plane with a portable USB charger. The connectors appear to be well made and fit well. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Dee NTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: Purchase this product. Very good quality. Best by a long shot.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. Canles these are amazing they are super quality. The length helps tremendously. They charge my phone i have several in my car and at wolk. You should definitely purchase this. You will not regret it. Trust me it will be the last cable you will need.
customer_reviews.author: Jayz

customer_reviews.title: No Need To Spend More, Buy These
customer_reviews.text: Ive always been happy with the quality of Cable Matters products. When I was looking for a USB-C to USB cable I was relieved to find That Cable Matters offered them. They are not the least expensive but they are the best quality at any price. No need to spend more, buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great little cable
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize when I bought my Nexus 5x that it didn't come with a USB-A to USB-C cable. I always like to have several chargers available, and decided to order a cable to take advantage of the plethora (that's right, I said plethora) of USB charger bases floating around my place. This cable is exactly what I needed for a fixed wall location setup, as well as using with laptop and car chargers. The shipment came quickly and the product was packaged in a heavily padded envelope.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy B.

customer_reviews.title: These cables come in handy since all the companies like to mismatch parts constantly
customer_reviews.text: Used these interchangeably with the Samsung and Google wall adapters. These cables come in handy since all the companies like to mismatch parts constantly. I've use this to charge Google phones, weight scales, Bluetooth speakers. The cables are great quality. I've been using them for about a year and they a have not shorn.
customer_reviews.author: ripmyshoes

customer_reviews.title: Did not charge
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to charge my Samsung Galaxy in my car. It did not charge. It actually seemed to drain battery. Did same for my friend's phone. Very disappointed. Probably not worth returning either.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay connected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my car with Android Auto and it won't hold the connection despite my phone laying flat and still. Missed the return window for one week so now I'm stuck.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer8754

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with the Nexus 6P
customer_reviews.text: Works fine on my Nexus 6P. They are well constructed and I was able to get a "rapid charging" display while using a 2.1a wall charger. Update : The original cable shipped to be did not have the correct resistors and failed the tests for the Nexus 6P. The company was quick to get back with me and send a replacement cable that passed the tests and worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! Do not buy - cable stopped charging after just 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I have taken good care of this USB cable and it stopped working without any warning after six weeks. Nothing charges on it anymore. The cable is not frayed or damaged, so I can't see any visible issues that would be causing the cable to stop charging. I tried a different USB cord and all my devices charge just fine, so the problem is definitely with the cable. Would not buy again. Choose a different USB-C charging cable!
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Buy for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable a long time ago. The cable worked and it was compatible with my Nexus, so I didn't think about leaving a review. But a year and a half later, I came back to give this cable and the company 5 stars. The original cable started to give out so I emailed the company and they quickly honored their lifetime warranty. Cable Matters has top notch customer service and they stand behind their product. Highly recommend not only this cable, but their entire lineup of products because of their commitment to customer satisfaction! Don't hesitate to do business with Cable Matters!
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this kind of charger for my Halo Charger that I lost... it works perfectly and there were 3! Great!
customer_reviews.author: The Queen Bee &amp; Me

customer_reviews.title: A good adapter cable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good cable for when you need to charge your phone or tablet on something like your laptop or desktop if it lacks a type C port and you just need to give it some juice. The cable is a bit thinner than I was expecting, though it doesn't necessarily feel fragile, so I wouldn't worry about it too much.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Supports QC 2.0
customer_reviews.text: I really love this cable. The end of the USB-C port is rounded slightly so it's not sharp or jagged where it will grab clothing or scratch your phone. I tested this cable with Quick Charge 2.0 and it worked at 9V and 0.9A. I've seen my phone use as much as 9V at 1.2A, so it was slightly less than I have seen, but it was still within the QC 2.0 specification. I'll be buying a few more in the next few days.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: One of the best USB-C cables I've used
customer_reviews.text: I wanted durable but thin-ish USB C cable for charging a Nexus 6p in a Volkswagen Jetta which has an AC outlet. Specifically, I wanted a cable flexible enough to snake below one of the seats and up near the dash. This cable worked out perfectly. Well made and it actually looks nice which is a bonus in a car.
customer_reviews.author: Loop Seven

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feeling but it charges things
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cord to charge my Nintendo Switch, and that is the only thing I have used it for. It charges the Switch fine, at the same speed as when the Switch is docked. The problem I have is the poor build quality of the cord. The plastic used is cheap and feels like it will soon break despite being brand new. The cord also doesn't feel like it's meant to be bent or manipulated--it is super thin and probably won't take much abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Mcclelland

customer_reviews.title: One of these 3 foot cables works great in my car so my cell phone has constant ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a wide assortment of cables from Cable Matters. All have performed well and have exceeded my expectations. One of these 3 foot cables works great in my car so my cell phone has constant power. I would definitely buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: K. Faaborg

customer_reviews.title: Lasts for about 2.5 years
customer_reviews.text: According to Amazon, I bought this March 8, 2017. As of today, January 6 2020 I found that the cable has started to break near the USB-C plug. This cable stays at my work computer so not a lot of movement. Probably pretty standard life for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Cheau Erl Lam

customer_reviews.title: Cable Matters 3-Pack Slim Series USB C Cable with 3A Fast Charging
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see the quality of these cables! I would reccomend these for purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: High quality cable.
customer_reviews.text: Been working fine for months, this cable gets thrown in either my pocket or my backpack every day so it gets bumped around and stretched. It just keeps on going and has no visible signs of wear or tear. Wish I could say the same for the battery life on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Chris HorryTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost replacement option
customer_reviews.text: As described and shipped with prime. Materials are not the most durable I have seen but for the price this was a good buy as a replacement option
customer_reviews.author: Colin Q

customer_reviews.title: This cable does not work with Android Auto.
customer_reviews.text: This cable does not work with Android Auto. I tried another USB B - C cable and it is working. so it is most likely something is wrong with this cable.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cord as a spare to keep at the office. It works perfectly to charge my Samsung Galaxy S8 Plus from the computer. I have not tested out the fast charging capabilities. It does exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: PaigeTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Nintendo Switch. It's too early to tell if there are issues with the cord breaking, but for now it works as intended - it charges my Switch, and that's the whole reason I got it. I'm sure I will use it again as more products use USBC, so this will definitely come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Spartan

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with mine.
customer_reviews.text: It came in a resealable plastic bag which was unexpected. No worries about having it tangled up or lost when not in use. (I keep mine at work, so it sees limited use). Much nicer than the typical hard plastic shell that requires scissors to open and goes right into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Plugged In
customer_reviews.text: Good product! Like the length better then the original that came with the phone. More versatile then the standard cable. Also like the color band on the plug ends which helps distinguish it from USB mini plugs.
customer_reviews.author: FeelingGood

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The product only worked from July 2019 to September 2019. Well built, didnt have any wires sticking out or any kinks in the cord. Mostly disappointed that it doesn't work. **UPDATE: Cable Matters reached out to me promptly and sent me a cable! Quick response and I received the replacement fast. Thank you! This cord is truly the perfect length.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: The yellow part reinforces & helps it not get lost!
customer_reviews.text: The little yellow part is actually really helpful when it's on a black surface (especially for people like me with bad vision). It also acts as reinforcement because you know that's where its most likely to break. It's also nice that they come with the little velcro part to wrap it up. I dont think you'll find a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Bell

customer_reviews.title: Fast charger!
customer_reviews.text: Charges my phone in an hour! My phone was literally not charging and even losing battery plugged into the charger that came with the phone. I lost all hope and thought it was my phone, but when I got this it started fast charging immediately! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for S8
customer_reviews.text: I received the S8 for my birthday, and had no idea it was a USB C. Picked this up to put in my car for travel charging. My phone is connected to blue tooth, so we use it for music daily. I never lose charge while traveling. Will probably buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: After having this cable for only a couple months, it has already worn enough to where it will not fast charge my Samsung device. To make sure it was not my device I tried it with two other cords that I possess and they fast charged my device. If you intend on having a cord that lasts for more than a few months charging as intended, steer clear of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Kraus

customer_reviews.title: Can be a hit or miss.
customer_reviews.text: Got really hot and could have caught fire had I not unplugged my phone. Was charging my HTC 10 yesterday with a Quick Charge 3.0 adapter. I removed the cable and noticed that it was immeasurably hot. Used this cable every day at work and now it has melted in the connection near my phone. Disposed of the cable instead out of safety concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G

customer_reviews.title: Great cable, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Hey, it's a cable, so there's not a lot that can go wrong with it, but this appears to be a quality cable. It has a little collar where the cables enter the USB heads, so hopefully that will contribute to them lasting a while. The cable is supple, which is nice since usually they retain the coil for weeks after they've been unpackaged. I'm impressed with the cable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Deb and Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Great! Charges my Android phone properly.
customer_reviews.text: I was using USB C adapters on a normal USB cable to charge my Android phones (two of them). Worked fine for about a year then stopped on one phone, then the other. Bought new adapters, still no luck. Tried these cables and all was solved.
customer_reviews.author: Matt @ LookIntoHawaiiDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, but takes a long time to fully charge
customer_reviews.text: A nice material looking/quality product, decent price, but it took hours to have my switch 100% charged, I tried it with my iPhone and my IPad chargers; while the official nintendo charger only takes over an hour to charge
customer_reviews.author: hechogamer

customer_reviews.title: Small Cable Big Power
customer_reviews.text: I use these to connect a wireless charger to my lamp and it is the perfect length and supplies power to an iPhone and Apple Watch with zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Bought this cable as a way to connect my Nexus ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cable as a way to connect my Nexus 5X to regular USB. I use the Type C side for my phone. The regular USB side, I plug in to the car, my Macs, and even my old iPad charger. I've had the cable for 6 months now of daily use. No problems here! I'd buy it again...
customer_reviews.author: J. Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Decent cables.
customer_reviews.text: They're USB c cables. They work. They look different than any manufacturer cable so I know they're mine. What more can I say. It charges phones. It does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Kap Kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cables!
customer_reviews.text: These cables represent an excellent value for the money. They make connecting and charging my devices easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few months...
customer_reviews.text: I used this cable to connect my phone to my 3rd party AndroidAuto head unit and needed the 6.6ft length to run the cable through my console. Connecting my phone to the USB-C end twice a day, the cable worked fine for ~6 months, but lately the connection to the phone drops if I don't have the cable perfectly straight. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: some guy

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The original cable I ordered had the plastic bit at the end falling apart, Cable Matters sent me a new one right away. The cable is solid like their micro-B connectors, it holds connection well after plugging in a lot and the cables are lightweight, but not cheap or flimsy. They're built to be minimal and get the job done while being durable and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my Google Pixel 2 XL and HP Laptop. I was having problems transferring my photos over from my old Galaxy S6 to my new Pixel in the new phone setup. I ended up copying the GS6 photos to my laptop using a regular Micro-USB to USB cable, then transfered them from the laptop to the pixel by manually copy/pasting them to the proper folders that open when you access the phone's directory on the laptop through the USB-C cable.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Fodera

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cable that works exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cable that works exactly as described. It is also made to proper USB-C specifications so there is no worry about damage to any devices.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: The one to buy!
customer_reviews.text: I tried MANY USB cabled trying to find one that was designed correctly and supported Android File Transfer. This cable does. I will now proceed to buy a few more to save. This is the cable to buy shoppers. Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with my nintendo switch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable to connect my nintendo switch to my laptop, which one must carefully select so as to not risk causing any damage to the unit. The connecting ends and cable itself are of good quality. No regrets not buying a higher priced cable, this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Cables.  Works with Lumia 950.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to charge my Microsoft Lumia 950. Nice and thin and coil up nicely for storage. Plug is a little tight but it I like the fact it won't wiggle out in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Don Baker

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I was able to put all of ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I was able to put all of my custom ringtones and wallpapers onto my new phone with the cable from my PC. I don't use it for charging my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tractorgal

customer_reviews.title: Great, then uh oh, then awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I was happy when I found these cables, as they seemed like a solid product at a solid price. The build quality is excellent and the fit of the connectors is rock solid. Then I discovered the issue with the noncompliance with the USB type c spec. A simple email to the seller, and the next day I have a full set of replacements on the way. Couldn't be happier with the cables or the customer service. These guys have won me over.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best C cable i ever had. i will buy another one because the original yesterday just stop working So i need a back up with this type of usb. it long enought, made of great materials and work for data and charging very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jairo Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: It only came with one
customer_reviews.text: It only came with one when it was supposed to be a 3 pack.
customer_reviews.author: sauvik

customer_reviews.title: Great - just not heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work and am up and down alot, meaning its goes through probably 20 unplugs and plugins to my phone daily. Holds up for about 4 months of that. So I gotta say, if you use it like a normal person it will work well. Not for heavy duty situations like mine.
customer_reviews.author: s1nemesis1s

customer_reviews.title: Great product, or my wife tells me.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wife, and she loves it. Primarily purchased for a day of Pokémon Go, She spent about 6 hrs of use (she stayed plugged in the whole time) and the power bar was around 75% full by the end of the day. It's a great size, as she can still fit it in her back pocket. She also has informed me that it charges her phone (galaxy s6 edge) faster than a wall charger or car charger. Unfortunately I do not know how long it takes to top off as I plug it in at the end when we go to bed. All in all its a great product and she highly recommends it.
customer_reviews.author: joseph loflin

customer_reviews.title: Works for Nexus 6p
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cable which charges my Huawei Nexus 6p well and its great for transferring data. Good cable overall, meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: tinydots

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should so far
customer_reviews.text: Works as described so far. I am u suing the se for my ikea charging pad.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Connect This
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well. I was able to make some minor improvement to my AppleTV 4th Gene. Oh how wonderful it is now! Amazon should just except the sale of the AppleTV because it shows faith in Amazon's own product and faith that Apple will honer Amazon's Prime Application when it comes out. This cable is great either way!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Cable frays after normal use
customer_reviews.text: Like others have reported, the cable frays after a while. The yellow strain sleeves only seems to change the place the cable falls apart. This is unacceptable for a cable in this day.
customer_reviews.author: D. Corritore

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product before (since Dec. 2016) and it is actually one of those cables that had good quality and lasts. The design is good and the cable doesn't easily split after a few times of use. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ishi

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I needed. Fits the Kindle HD 10 just great!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Too bad I didn't have it for my cruise
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to charge my Nintendo Switch with my extra capacity charger. Too bad I didn't have it for my cruise :( Great product, great buy! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: G. Harrod

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a good price
customer_reviews.text: This cable works well for my Pixel. It is a sturdy cable. I'll be buying more for the house, office, etc.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to connect my new phone to an existing battery pack. This cable was spot on. Love the quality and the little velcro tab was a definite plus
customer_reviews.author: gnance

product_meta.title: Cable Matters 3-Pack Slim Series USB C Cable with 3A Fast Charging in Black 3.3 Feet for Samsung Galaxy S20, S20+, S20 Ultra, Note 10, Note 10+, LG G8, V50, Google Pixel 4, and More
feature_bullets: NEWEST STYLE USB TYPE-C CABLE - USBC charger cable connects a computer, wall charger, or external power bank with USB-A to a tablet or smartphone with this USB-C charger cable for USB Type C cable fast charging and data syncing

REVERSIBLE CONNECTOR DESIGN - Low profile USB to USB C cable simplifies the connection; USB C to A cable plugs and unplugs easily without checking for the connector orientation with this USB to USBC cable

ENGINEERED TO LAST USB C charger cable - Flexible USBC to USB cable with sturdy construction has connectors with molded strain relief for frequent unplugging and durability; Robust USB to USB C adapter cable clicks into place for a snug and secure connection

ENGINEERED TO LAST USB C charger cable - Flexible USBC to USB cable with sturdy construction has connectors with molded strain relief for frequent unplugging and durability; Robust USB to USB C adapter cable clicks into place for a snug and secure connection

LEGACY COMPANION USB C charging cable - High Speed USB Type C charger cable connects computers with legacy USB ports to new release tablets and smartphones with USB Type C for seamless operation; Convenient and cost-effective 2-pack USB C cord provides spare or replacement cables to keep at the desktop, in your accessory bag, or in the car
